The Sirkali police have launched a manhunt for two persons who allegedly hacked a local office-bearer of the Pattali Makkal Katchi with a sword near here on Saturday night. T. Chinnamani alias Selvam , a mechanic, and Sirkali North Union PMK unit secretary, was returning home riding a motorbike when two persons intercepted Mani near the Patahirakudi Bypass and hacked him. Selvam was injured on his wrist, back, and head. Hearing the commotion, passersby rescued Selvam and rushed him to the Sirkali GH. Based on Selvam’s complaint, Sirkali police registered a case and are on the look out for the two who assaulted him.

Governor to visit

Thanjavur

Governor K. Rosiah will preside over the convocation of the Tamil University slated for Saturday. A total of 125 candidates will be conferred doctoral degrees while 651 other students would be given M. Phil degrees during the convocation. Minister for School Education, Tamil Official Language and Tamil Culture K.C. Veeramani, and Secretary of Information and Tamil Development M. Rajaram will attend the programme, according to a release by the Tamil University Vice-Chancellor G. Bhaskaran.
title: PMK worker assaulted
